metadata.titel_preek: There Is Power In That Cross

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a broken, segregated, and impotent society through the power of the Cross to transform human hearts and create a unified 'new world' (the family of God).

tekstueel_bewijs: There is power in that cross to take the flinty rock of our selfishness and to turn it into gushing fountains of service
We have a Christ who gives us the power
the glorious liberty of the sons of God
new world a-coming, cleansed of pride and prejudice

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Sovereign King
tekstueel_bewijs: the provision of the evangel of grace which has been committed to our hands

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity (every kindred, tongue, people, and nation)
tekstueel_bewijs: hast redeemed us to God by thy blood
the creature shall be changed from corruption

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Evangel / The Cross
tekstueel_bewijs: the power to accompany that command
the banners of dawn are in the skies
bastions and ramparts of evil’s dark kingdom
the flinty rock of our selfishness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'evil's dark kingdom' and 'corruption' that requires a 'triumphant act of mercy' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the church to social injustice and racial segregation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The power of the Cross (Primary) enables the service and brotherhood (Secondary). The preacher explicitly rejects moralism without the power of the Cross.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Holy Spirit → The Cross ← Evil's Kingdom/Selfishness

voorbeelden_god_subject: thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us

voorbeelden: I've been wanting you to have it
men who know the right will do the right
There is power in that cross
He never to give a command without giving the power

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon moves from the 'Devoir' (Law/Social necessity) to the 'Pouvoir' (Grace/Cross), arguing that human obligation is impossible without divine empowerment.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the impotence of human expediency (~S1) and the weight of the law (~S2) to the contrary reality of the Cross (S1) which overcomes the dark kingdom (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'triumphant act of mercy' on Calvary which provides the 'Pouvoir' that the 'Devoir' of Sinai could not.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as a 'dark kingdom' and 'flinty rock' of selfishness.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon addresses social and moral issues, it explicitly identifies 'moralistic exhortations' as a failure and positions the Cross as the sole source of power for change.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we must stop... because the world is watching us

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It was his wisdom never to give a command without giving the power

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; rather, the disciples are used as witnesses to the power they received.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The disciples are receivers of power, not heroes of their own will.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-improvement; empowerment through the Cross.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon maintains a tight link between the failure of human effort and the necessity of divine power.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'must' of social justice and the 'cannot' of human nature.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: destroy the bastions and ramparts of evil’s dark kingdom

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is an 'insuperable burden' and 'dark night'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully shifts the Subject from the 'expedient human' to the 'empowering Christ'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition from Devoir to Pouvoir is the sermon's greatest strength.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as systemic and internal evil.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism while addressing social crisis. It correctly identifies the Cross as the actant of power.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the pathos of the school story; Greimassian analysis reveals that story as a foil for human impotence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Revelation 5; this analysis focuses on how that text functions as a 'Sender' of new values.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'voices of expediency' are actually 'Opponents' disguised as 'Senders'.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly critiques its own potential for moralism.
